text: Hans Hollein (30 March 1934 - 24 April 2014) was an Austrian architect, designer, sculptor and architectural theorist. His best known works were: Museum f√ºr Moderne Kunst and Haas House. He was also the winner of the Pritzker Architecture Prize in 1985. He was born in Vienna. Hollein died from pneumonia on 24 April 2014 in Vienna. He was 80. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1934 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Austrian architects Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Disease-related deaths in Austria Category:People from Vienna Category:Sculptors Category:Pritzker Architecture Prize winners
